attributes.action: prevent garage forecourts and supermarkets promoting the sale of cheap alcohol
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: The great British tradition of visiting a village pub is under threat as garage forecourts and supermarkets compete ever harder to sell alcohol as cheaply as possible.  Whilst we may never be able to prevent them from selling at a loss to attract business, we petition that they be banned from advertising and promoting the sale of cheap alcohol through television, newspaper and roadside media.  Such advertising is damaging to the pub trade and is easily read by the young, encouraging underage drinkers to purchase alcohol.  Pubs provide a safe and responsible environment for people to enjoy a drink and the promotion of cheap alcohol is both dangerous and damaging to the pub trade whilst acting as a catalyst to underage sales and binge drinking.  We petition to ban the advertising of alcohol by supermarkets and petrol forecourts and support the great village pub.
